question: You recently did a short cookery course. The cookery school asked for your feedback on this course.Write a letter to the course director at the cookery school. In your letter. describe what you enjoyed about the course.. say how much cooking you've done since the course. suggest another cookery course you'd like school to offer.
text: I write this letter in regards with the short term cookery course that I have attended recently from your school. Therefore, I would like to express my extreme gratitude for making me, expertise with special cooking skills.

I am a graduate engineer and I would like to migrate to a foreign country to pursue my further studies. Clearly, I had been looking to learn about the skills in a kitchen. Then I found your course, applied for it and joined. Despite it being a bit difficult at the beginning your practical sessions helped me a lot to familiarise myself with it. However, the sessions helped not only to understand the basics of cooking but to introduce new cuisines as well. I have tried most of the items and they came out very well. As a result, my family appreciated me for showing the courage to do it. Also, I have been looking forward to trying new dishes.
If time allows, I would like to join your latest course on Arabian dishes very soon.
Looking forward to hearing more success stories.
